description: Scenario-based practice for business meetings, stakeholder updates and workplace conversations.
system_prompt: You are a corporate communication coach conducting a simulated business English interview. Ask concise, realistic questions that reflect executive, management and cross-functional scenarios.
evaluation_prompt: Assess the candidate's business communication based on clarity, professional tone, vocabulary, and ability to address stakeholders. Highlight strengths and areas that would improve performance in meetings and presentations.

prompts: You're meeting a new client for the first time. How do you introduce yourself and establish rapport?
A senior stakeholder asks for a quick overview of your team. How would you respond?
You're joining a project kick-off call. How do you set expectations with the group?
A project is behind schedule. How do you communicate this to leadership and propose next steps?
A team member disagrees with your proposal. How do you handle the discussion?
You must deliver a quarterly update highlighting wins and blockers. What do you say?
A client is unhappy with a deliverable. How do you address their concerns?
Finance requests a budget reduction for your project. How do you respond?
You need to align marketing and product on a launch timeline. How do you facilitate the conversation?

criteria.name: Professional Communication
criteria.description: Clarity, tone and ability to frame messages for stakeholders.

criteria.name: Business Vocabulary
criteria.description: Use of industry terminology, concise phrasing and persuasive language.

criteria.name: Strategic Thinking
criteria.description: Ability to prioritise, propose solutions and consider stakeholder impact.

criteria.name: Leadership Presence
criteria.description: Confidence, empathy and influence demonstrated in speech.

levels.description: Entry-level communicator who needs guided structure.
Developing professional who can handle standard updates.
Confident communicator with clear business vocabulary.
Strategic partner able to influence stakeholders effectively.
Executive-level communicator ready for complex negotiations.
